intro: Senecio dolichopappus, commonly known as the long-pappus senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Senecio dolichopappus is also known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
